messages.content: I am seeking the strongest possible mandate to represent the values that we share and the interests of everyone in our area. If I am re-elected on Thursday 8 June, I will keep fighting the Tories and working for Dulwich and West Norwood.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: I will fight against the damaging impact of a hard Brexit on our area and country.
Campaigning against the cuts and working to secure funding for King’s College Hospital.
Working against the funding cuts that will damage our schools and the life chances of our children.
Making our area fairer for everyone.
Working to protect our environment and tackle climate change again.
Ensuring that we have an effective police force.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Locally it’s a straight choice between Labour and strengthening the Tories mandate for a hard Brexit.

issues.brexitEurope: The Tories are seeking a hard Brexit, which would damage our economy, our environment and human rights.
issues.education: Opposing funding cuts that will damage our schools and life chances.
issues.environment: Working to protect our environment and tackle climate change again.
issues.health: Fighting for our NHS, campaigning against the cuts and working to secure funding for King’s College Hospital.
issues.lawCrime: Ensuring that we have an effective police force.

politicalExperience.role: Labour Parliamentary Candidate for Dulwich and West Norwood

contactInformation.address: Dulwich and West Norwood Labour Party, 3 Effra Road, Brixton, SW2 1BZ

examples: If I am re-elected on Thursday 8 June
I am seeking the strongest possible mandate to represent the values that we share and the interests of everyone in our area.
I will keep fighting the Tories and working for Dulwich and West Norwood.
Locally it’s a straight choice between Labour and strengthening the Tories mandate for a hard Brexit.
Remember this election is straight fight between Labour and the Tories nationally and locally – a vote for the Dems or the Greens locally will just let the Tories in.
I will stand against the cuts and work to secure funding for King’s College Hospital.
I will keep fighting the Tories and working for Dulwich and West Norwood.
Remember this election is straight fight between Labour and the Tories nationally and locally – a vote for the Dems or the Greens locally will just let the Tories in.
I will keep fighting the Tories and working for Dulwich and West Norwood.
